    public class UserManager
extends AbstractEntityManagerImpl
implements com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.FilterHandler<UserDto>
    Business Layer user account management.

      • create

        public void create(UserDto user,
          UserDto userToCreate,
          java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> groupIds,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> licenses,
          com.intland.codebeamer.manager.util.ActionData actionData)
            throws ChangeVetoedException,
                   AccessRightsException
        Creates a new user account.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that wants to create a new user account
        userToCreate - is the specification of the new user account to create
        groupIds - are the Ids of the user groups, the new user should become member of, or null, to assign the new user to the default user groups
        licenses - are the licenses to assign to the new user, or null, to assign the new user to the default license
        actionData - is optional information about the current request
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - is the user is not a system admin
        ChangeVetoedException

      • update

        public void update(UserDto user,
          UserDto userToUpdate,
          java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> groupIds,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> licenses,
          com.intland.codebeamer.manager.util.ActionData actionData)
            throws AccessRightsException,
                   ChangeVetoedException
        Updates an existing user account.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that wants to update an existing user account
        userToUpdate - The user account to modify
        groupIds - The ids of the groups the user will be member of. If null then the groups-memberships are not modified, but an empty collection will remove all group memberships.
        actionData - request related data
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException
        ChangeVetoedException

      • getDefaultUserLicense

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> getDefaultUserLicense(boolean forNewUsers)
        Get the default license (for new users)
        Parameters:
        forNewUsers - true to get the default license for new users, false to get the primary installed license
        Returns:
        a Map with a single entry for the default license and user type combination of new users
        Since:
        CB-6.1

      • validateUserLicenses

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> validateUserLicenses(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> licenses,
                                                                   boolean addDefault,
                                                                   boolean forNewUsers)
        Validate the specified user licenses
        Parameters:
        licenses - to validate
        addDefault - whether to return default license assignments if licenses is null or empty
        forNewUsers - true to add the default license for new users, false to add the primary installed license
        Returns:
        the validated licenses
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the license combination is not allowed (e.g. user and customer licenses mixed)

      • checkNamedUserLicenseAvailability

        public void checkNamedUserLicenseAvailability(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     UserDto user,
                                     int count,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,UserLicenseType> licenses)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Check if the specified licenses can be assigned to the specified user
        Parameters:
        request - to localize the exeption message
        user - to assign the licenses to
        licenses - to assign
        count - is the number of additional licenses requested
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no free (named) licenses of the requested type is available
        Since:
        CB-6.1

        Set the license associations of the specified user within an enclosing create/update user transaction
        Parameters:
        transaction - is the enclosing create/update user transaction
        user - is the user who sets the license associations of the subject user
        subject - is the user whose license associations to set
        licenses - is a Map of user type per associated license type (key can be null, to set default user type for default license)
